definition[0]: used to talk about someone being worried or frightened
note[0]: somebody’s nerves are on edge/in tatters/frayed (=someone feels very worried or frightened)
example[0]: Sean drank a large glass of brandy to calm his nerves.
example[1]: I remember you were a bundle of nerves on your wedding day.
definition[1]: the feeling of being worried or a little frightened
example[2]: A lot of people suffer from nerves before they go on stage.
example[3]: ‘What’s wrong with Rachel?’ ‘It’s just nerves. She’s got her driving test tomorrow.’
